metadata.Description: Liquefied natural gas (LNG) is natural gas that has been cooled to a liquid state for easier storage and transportation.

subelement_relations.Description: The liquefaction process is a crucial step in the production of liquefied natural gas. It involves cooling natural gas to a very low temperature, transforming it into a liquid state for easier storage and transportation.

Storage and transportation are essential aspects of the liquefied natural gas industry. LNG is stored in specialized tanks and transported using LNG carriers to various destinations, enabling the global trade of natural gas.

The regasification process is the reverse of the liquefaction process. It involves heating liquefied natural gas back to its gaseous state, making it suitable for distribution and use in various applications.

LNG terminals are specialized facilities where liquefied natural gas is received, stored, and regasified. They play a crucial role in the import and export of LNG, ensuring its efficient distribution.

LNG carriers are specially designed ships used for the transportation of liquefied natural gas. They are equipped with advanced insulation and safety systems to ensure the safe and efficient delivery of LNG to different ports.

relations.Description: Liquefied natural gas addresses energy access challenges by providing a reliable and cleaner energy source.
Liquefied natural gas employs cryogenic technology for the storage and transportation of natural gas.
Liquefied natural gas collaborates with shipping companies for the transportation of LNG.
Liquefied natural gas supports the clean energy transition by providing a lower-carbon alternative to other fossil fuels.
Liquefied natural gas administers LNG import terminals for the storage and regasification of LNG.
Liquefied natural gas measures greenhouse gas emissions to ensure compliance with environmental regulations.
Liquefied natural gas aligns with energy security objectives by diversifying energy sources.
Liquefied natural gas is an instance of natural gas in its liquid form.

relations-level-2.Subject: energy markets

relations-level-2.Subject: energy democracy
relations-level-2.Description: Energy democracy addresses energy inequality by promoting equitable access to clean and affordable energy for all individuals and communities.
